alert.note: Alert for Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Tyrrell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hyde, west central Dare and southeastern Tyrrell Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 648 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gum Neck, or 21 miles west of Stumpy Point, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gum Neck and Frying Pan Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
